intro: Hieracium anthracocephalum, commonly known as the black-headed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, with a basal rosette of leaves and a flowering stem that bears yellow flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are arranged in a dense cluster at the top of the stem. Hieracium anthracocephalum is often found in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, and it can spread through rhizomes and seed dispersal.
